mainEntity.name: How much do disability home modifications cost in Buffalo?

acceptedAnswer.text: Disability home modifications in Buffalo range from $3,000-$50,000 depending on needs. Sensory rooms $3,500-$8,000, safety systems $2,000-$6,000, accessible bathrooms $8,000-$18,000, complete home modifications $15,000-$50,000. Many modifications are covered by insurance, Medicaid waivers, and New York state programs with proper documentation.

mainEntity.name: What disabilities do you specialize in for Buffalo home modifications?

acceptedAnswer.text: Aaron Michael Services specializes in modifications for autism spectrum disorders, cerebral palsy, intellectual and developmental disabilities, mobility impairments, sensory processing disorders, and multiple disabilities. Personal experience as father of son with autism provides deep understanding of sensory needs, safety concerns, and family dynamics.

mainEntity.name: Are disability home modifications covered by insurance in New York?

acceptedAnswer.text: Many disability modifications are covered by insurance and New York state programs. Medicaid waivers provide up to $15,000 for home modifications, Medicare covers medically necessary equipment, private insurance often covers accessibility improvements. Aaron Michael Services helps navigate funding with 78% approval success rate.

mainEntity.name: How long do disability home modifications take to complete?

acceptedAnswer.text: Disability home modification timelines vary by project scope: Sensory rooms 3-5 days, safety systems 1-2 days, accessible bathrooms 5-7 days, complete home modifications 1-3 weeks. Buffalo permit processing may add time, but we work efficiently to minimize disruption to families with special needs.

acceptedAnswer.text: Yes, Aaron Michael Services specializes in creating sensory rooms for children with autism in Buffalo.
